blog3.title: Teaching Automata Kits at Ordu
blog3.text: On December 5–6, 2025, members of our team taught basic assembly, mechanical systems, and introduced augmented reality by handing out over 40 Automata kits per 4 sessions at our sister school in Ordu as part of the Learn–Teach (Öğren-Öğret) project.

blog2.title: Lemon Robotics Training at Ordu
blog2.text: On December 5–6, 2025, members of our team provided basic mechanics, electronics, and coding training through more than 40 Lemon Robotics kits per 4 sessions at our sister school in Ordu as part of the Learn–Teach (Öğren-Öğret) project.

blog4.title: Coding Summit: Lemon Robotics Workshops
blog4.text: On 12-13 December 2025, we hosted the 12th annual Coding Summit at Hisar School and held Lemon workshops, reaching a total of 200+ students

blog5.title: Coding Summit: Automata Workshop
blog5.text: During 12-13 December 2025, we hosted workshops of Automata at the 12th Coding Summit. We were able to teach basic mechanical systems to a total of 200+ students.

blog6.title: Innovation Summit: Lemon Robotics Workshops
blog6.text: On 16-17th of February 2025, members of our team went to American Community Schools of Athens for the innovation summit in which they conducted Lemon workshops, reaching over 100 students.

blog7.title: Innovation Summit: Automata Workshops
blog7.text: On 16-17th of February 2025, members of our team went to American Community Schools of Athens for the innovation summit in which they conducted Automata workshops, reaching over 100 students and distributing over 600 kits.

blog8.title: Coding Summit: micro:bit
blog8.text: On 12-13 December 2025, during our 12th Coding Summit, we held micro:bit workshops and a micro:bit competition, reaching 80+ students.

blog9.title: Coding Summit: Picksy
blog9.text: At our 12th Coding Summit, 12-13 December 2025, we held R&D prototyping workshops centered on Picksy, reaching 80+ students and helping them (rhythmically) brainstorm ideas.)

blog12.title: YODEN Workshops at Hisar School
blog12.text: On January 14-15, 2026, members of our team provided 3 modules: exploring trial-and-error optimization through maze-based path generation, pattern-matching selection systems, and probabilistic discovery games that mirror how AI refines models from random variations into effective solutions to 200+ students
